What are the complications of Vesicoureteral Reflux ?,"When a child with VUR gets a UTI, bacteria can move into the kidney and lead to scarring. Scarring of the kidney can be associated with high blood pressure and kidney failure. However, most children with VUR who get a UTI recover without long-term complications.",NIDDK,Vesicoureteral Reflux
How to diagnose Vesicoureteral Reflux ?,"The most common tests used to diagnose VUR include
                
- Voiding cystourethrogram (VCUG).
